Basic details: Mary Johnson, a 49-year-old female, presents to the clinic with jaundice.
Vitals:
BP: 130/75 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Appear visibly jaundiced with yellowing of the skin and sclera.
Complain of mild abdominal discomfort.
Express fatigue and a general feeling of malaise.
If liver function tests are mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What are liver function tests?”
Challenging question: “Is this something serious with my liver? Could it be cancer?”
